page.title: 10OLD FOLK IN WARBOYS
page.content: The Royal British Legion flats were opened to accomodate pensioners who have been in the services.They are warden controlled with alarm cords.The oldest person is 92,the youngest is 60.We interviewed two of the tenants. {Miss Bateman.}She has lived in Warboys for 75 years.Her father was an odd job man at the Manor House. She used her bike but she still remembered the trains coming to Warboys. {Mrs Smith.}She said there were 16 public houses and 3 windmills. Her father was a shepherd and owned 200 sheep.Today people don't keep many animals and most farms are arable.{ {Mrs. Smith}said that she had to take her own kettle and cocoa to school for her dinner. Today there are only 2 pubs and the windmills have been knocked down.
